intro: Orthophytum sucrei, commonly known as the Sucre's orthophytum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in parts of Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of trichomes, giving it a woolly appearance. It produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
